creator: raph@pobox.com
text:
Products used: Jakarta-tomcat: 3.2.2 JDK: 1.3.1 OS: Windows 2000 on Dell Dual-processor 500mz Whenever I try to run a JSP page that has a 'switch case' statement, I get several errors: (See Below) org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSPD:\jsp\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.2\work\localhost_8080 \_0002fProjects_0002fTest_0002ejspTest_jsp_1.java:70: Statement not reached. out.write("\r\n"); ^ D:\jsp\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.2\work\localhost_8080 \_0002fProjects_0002fTest_0002ejspTest_jsp_1.java:82: Statement not reached. out.write("\r\n"); ^ D:\jsp\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.2\work\localhost_8080 \_0002fProjects_0002fTest_0002ejspTest_jsp_1.java:94: Statement not reached. out.write("\r\n"); ^ 3 errors Here is the Test.jsp code I used to create the problem: Control Flow Statements <% int nDay = 1; %> The current day is:
<% switch (nDay) { %> <% case 1: %> Sunday
<% break; %> <% default: %> Error! Bad day!
<% break; %> <% } %>

creator: nacho@apache.org
text:
This is badly writed JSP^, this way works without problems: Control Flow Statements <% int nDay = 1; %> The current day is:
<% switch (nDay) { case 1: %> Sunday
<% break; default: %> Error! Bad day!
<% break; } %> This is not a bug, because Jasper is only translating the chars present in the original document, and there is a \r\n in between the break and the next case, later java doesnt permit dead code, but this is another history.. for now works for me.
